page.title: 05LANDSCAPE-1
page.content: Idlicote sits on a low partly wooded hill of 110 metres.it is grouped around a large village pond fringed with reeds and willow trees,which is the home of wildfowl.The woods are mainly deciduous,of ash,sycamore and oak.There are many trees and bushes in the village and areas of grass adjoining the pond and roads giving a spacious feeling.There are 5 houses built of local blue lyas and Hornton stone one of which is thatched.The remaining 24 are brick.Idlicote house is on the site of an ancient fortified building with a moat. Oxhill and Whatcote lie on the heavy brown clay in the vale of the red horse and are surrounded by open fields many still with ridge and furrow,and surrounded by well trimmed hedges.
